greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Integer coefficients of A(x), where 1<=a(n)<=8, such that A(x)^(1/8) consists entirely of integer coefficients.
comment: More generally the sequence, "integer coefficients of A(x), where 1<=a(n)<=m, such that A(x)^(1/m) consists entirely of integer coefficients", appears to have a unique solution for all m. Are these sequences periodic?
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..3000.
mathematica: a[0] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Block[{k = 1, s = Sum[a[i]*x^i, {i, 0, n-1}]}, While[ Union[ IntegerQ /@ CoefficientList[ Series[(s+k*x^n)^(1/8), {x, 0, n}], x]] != {True}, k++ ]; k]; Table[ a[n], {n, 0, 104}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, May 09 2003
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 26 2005
